alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 27 at 11:23AM PST until December 28 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 45 to 55 mph expected. Strongest winds will peak Tuesday evening through early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Worley, Fairfield, Ephrata, Coulee City, Airway Heights, Spokane Valley, Wilbur, Harrington, Post Falls, Waterville, Badger Mountain Road, Davenport, Grand Coulee, Hayden, Coeur d`Alene, Othello, Odessa, Creston, Downtown Spokane, Ritzville, Mansfield, Cheney, Quincy, Moses Lake, and Rockford. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Strong cross-winds may impact travel on west-east roadways and interstates.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau
